Prof Ni is an IEEE 1932.1 standard Voting Member. He is a Vice Chair of Big Data with Computational Intelligence SIG, IEEE Technical Committee on Big Data. He was an IEEE 802.11 Wireless LAN standard Voting Member. China CSC PhD applicants/visitors are very welcome! Show more… Profile Prof Qiang Ni is a Professor in Communications and Networking at School of Computing and Communications and he is with Data Science Institute and Security Lancaster Center at Lancaster University. He is the Head of Communication Systems Research Group and the School's Director of International Partnership (previously was School's Director of Postgraduate Studies and School's Deputy Director of Research). Prof Ni is a Fellow of IET, Fellow of Higher Education Academy and Senior Member of IEEE. China CSC PhD or visitors are very welcome! IEEE Access Journal Special Issue on “Artificial Intelligence Enabled Networking (AI-enabled Networking)”, 2015; IET Network Journal Special Issue on “A Smarter Environment through the Advancements of Communication Systems, Networks and Applications”, 2015; Conference Chair: Chairing various IEEE conferences, including IEEE ICC 2021, Cognitive Radio & AI-Enabled Networks Symposia, IEEE ICC 2020 workshop on ULMC6G networks Executive Committee, IEEE CPSCom 2017, mmWave5G 2016, IEEE ICUMT’ 2014/13/11/10/09, IUCC 12, CIT 10. Senior Program Committee Member of AAAI-26 (AAAI Conference on Artificial Intelligence 2026). TPC committee member of over 100 international conferences, including regulary for IEEE Globecom, ICC. Keynote Speaker at conferences such as IEEE GreenCom-2017, I-SPAN 2017.
